column5: I have seen the question "How much is the duty?" many times, especially for alcohol. So this should help. This calculator is also available as a phone app.www.canadiandutycalculator.ca
Thanks - NARDA. ...Your link has a comma in it instead of a period, this will work better:http://www.canadiandutycalculator.ca/
we paid $48.00 on 6 cases of beer and a 1.75 liter of rum. How that broke down I have no idea
Does anyone have the web site or know where I can find out how much duty I would have to pay bringing spirits back across the border? There has to be something printed to calculate bringing it home.
Do you actually have spirits to bring back to the US?
When our group brings Rye back we pay $2.85 per liter bottle. I read somewhere that the USA charges an excise tax of $10.80 per gallon on whiskey.

I ran the numbers on a $60 bottle of Scotch and a case of beer. Darn near doubled to price of the Scotch, and added 50% to the cost of the beer. ...there's nothing I need to drink that much...especially given how much I can bring in for free.
That would track with my experience. When we've gone in "over", it's been suggested by the Canadian Border guards to claim the hard liquor and pay duty on the beer.
